intro: Cissus kiwakishiensis, commonly known as the African stonecrop, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, berry-like fruits. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal habitats. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated for ornamental purposes.
